sources: Louisiana Department of Wildlife and Fisheries (LDWF)
notes: Regulations are subject to change. Always verify with official state agencies before fishing.
Federal waters regulations may differ from state waters.
Some regulations vary by geographic sub-regions within states.
Emergency orders and proclamations may supersede published regulations.
Possession limits typically equal 2x daily bag limit unless otherwise noted.

license_requirements.notes: Trout permit required for trout fishing. Possession limit is triple the daily limit statewide.

species.bag_limit_notes: Combined total for all black bass species
species.special_regulations: Lake Monticello: 5 fish daily with only 1 over 16 inches
species.geographic_restrictions: Ozark Zone has 12-inch minimum; elsewhere 10 inches

species.minimum_size_notes: 12 inches in Ozark Zone; 10 inches elsewhere
species.special_regulations: Specific limit of 4 smallmouth within aggregate
Part of 10-fish black bass aggregate
6-fish combined limit with hybrids
6-fish combined limit with striped bass

species.bag_limit_notes: Combined with blue and flathead catfish
Combined with channel and flathead catfish
Combined with channel and blue catfish

species.special_regulations: No daily limit

Lake Monticello: 15 fish with max 7 over 12 inches

species.bag_limit_notes: Combined with other bream species; fish under 4 inches have no limit
species.special_regulations: No limit on fish under 4 inches

species.bag_limit_notes: Combined bream limit; fish under 4 inches have no limit

species.minimum_size_notes: 18 inches on Beaver Lake and Table Rock Lake
species.bag_limit_notes: 4 on Beaver and Table Rock; 6 elsewhere
species.special_regulations: Special regulations on specific lakes
species.geographic_restrictions: Size and bag limits vary by water body

species.minimum_size_notes: Upper White River and North Fork: must be under 14 inches
species.maximum_size_notes: On upper White River and North Fork from dams to Norfork Access
species.bag_limit_notes: Upper White/North Fork: 2 rainbow under 14 inches. Lower White: varies. General statewide: 5 trout combined with max 2 of each type
species.special_regulations: New 2026 regulations effective Feb 1 due to hatchery crisis. Upper tailwaters: 2 rainbow under 14 inches only. Lower White River: complex slot limits.
species.geographic_restrictions: Highly variable by water body, especially on White River system

species.minimum_size_notes: On upper White River and North Fork from dams to Norfork Access: must be released. Lower White River: 24 inches minimum if kept
species.bag_limit_notes: Upper White/North Fork: must be released. Lower White River Norfork Access to Hwy 58: 1 brown over 24 inches allowed. General statewide: 5 trout combined with max 2 of each type
species.special_regulations: Catch and release only on upper tailwaters. Very restrictive harvest on lower White River.
species.geographic_restrictions: Different regulations by section of White River

species.minimum_size_notes: On upper White River and North Fork: must be released. Lower White River: 24 inches minimum
species.bag_limit_notes: Upper tailwaters: must be released. Lower White: 1 cutthroat over 24 inches allowed. General statewide: 5 trout combined with max 2 of each type
species.special_regulations: Catch and release only on upper tailwaters
species.geographic_restrictions: Different regulations by section of White River

species.minimum_size_notes: On upper White River and North Fork: must be released. Lower White: 14 inches minimum
species.bag_limit_notes: Upper tailwaters: must be released. Lower White: 1 brook over 14 inches allowed. General statewide: 5 trout combined with max 2 of each type
species.special_regulations: Catch and release only on upper tailwaters
species.geographic_restrictions: Different regulations by section of White River

species.special_regulations: Snagging permitted during designated seasons
Check current guidebook for specific regulations
21-inch minimum size

license_requirements.freshwater: Basic Fishing License required for age 18+ for freshwater species
license_requirements.saltwater: Saltwater License required for age 18+ for areas south of saltwater line
license_requirements.notes: Both licenses may be required depending on location. State waters extend to 3 miles offshore in Gulf of Mexico.

species.minimum_size_notes: Most waters: no minimum. Eagle Lake: 16 inches. False River: 14 inches. Toledo Bend/Sabine River: 14 inches. Various slot limits on specific waters.
species.bag_limit_notes: Most waters: 10. Bussey Brake: 5 daily/10 possession with max 1 over 16 inches. Poverty Point: 8 with max 1 over 19 inches. Toledo Bend/Sabine: 8 aggregate with all bass species.
species.special_regulations: Multiple slot limits and special regulations on specific water bodies

species.minimum_size_notes: Same as largemouth bass by water body
species.bag_limit_notes: Combined with largemouth bass in most waters
species.special_regulations: Same special regulations as largemouth by water body

species.bag_limit_notes: Most waters: 50. Caddo Lake/Sabine/Toledo Bend: no limit

species.special_regulations: Only 2 fish over 30 inches allowed

species.bag_limit_notes: Combined with striped bass; max 2 over 30 inches
species.special_regulations: Only 2 fish over 30 inches allowed in combined limit

species.minimum_size_notes: Most waters: no minimum. Eagle Lake: 11 inches. Bussey Brake: 10 inches
species.bag_limit_notes: Most waters: 50. Poverty Point/Caddo/Sabine/Toledo Bend: 25. Eagle Lake: 30. D'Arbonne Lake: 50 with max 7 over 12 inches
species.special_regulations: Toledo Bend has 100 possession limit

species.minimum_size_notes: Same as white crappie by water body
species.special_regulations: Same as white crappie by water body

species.bag_limit_notes: 15 per person; max 2 over 20 inches. New slot limit (13-20 inches) effective November 20
species.special_regulations: Charter captain and crew bag limit is zero. Slot limit in effect.

species.bag_limit_notes: 4 fish per person within slot limit. Charter captain/crew bag limit is zero
species.special_regulations: Slot limit: 18-27 inches total length. Retention over 27 inches prohibited. Take or possession in federal waters prohibited.

species.bag_limit_notes: 5 daily per person; only 1 fish may exceed 27 inches
species.special_regulations: Slot limit with one over-slot fish allowed
Fall closure to protect spawning fish
Season dates announced annually based on quota

species.bag_limit_notes: 4 daily in aggregate with other groupers

license_requirements.notes: Paddlefish permit required for paddlefish fishing. Special regulations apply on many public fishing areas and state parks.

species.bag_limit_notes: Rivers/streams: 6 combined black bass with only 1 over 16 inches. Lakes: varies by water body
species.special_regulations: No culling allowed. Only 1 fish over 16 inches in rivers/streams
species.geographic_restrictions: Different regulations for rivers/streams vs lakes

species.bag_limit_notes: Rivers/streams: only 1 smallmouth allowed within 6-fish black bass limit
species.special_regulations: Limited to 1 fish in rivers/streams
species.geographic_restrictions: Specific limit for rivers and streams

species.special_regulations: No size limit on spotted bass

species.bag_limit_notes: 5 per day; varies on Lake Texoma
species.special_regulations: No culling allowed. Lake Texoma has special regulations
No culling allowed. Reclassified as game fish

species.bag_limit_notes: 15 combined with blue catfish; only 1 blue over 30 inches. Some waters have 6-fish limit
species.special_regulations: State parks and forest service lakes have 6-fish limit

species.bag_limit_notes: 15 combined with channel catfish; only 1 blue over 30 inches
species.special_regulations: Only 1 fish over 30 inches allowed. State parks have 6-fish limit

species.bag_limit_notes: 37 combined with black crappie. Blue River PFA: 6 fish

species.bag_limit_notes: 3 combined with brown trout and other trout species
species.special_regulations: No culling of trout allowed

species.bag_limit_notes: 3 combined with rainbow and other trout
species.special_regulations: No culling of trout allowed

license_requirements.saltwater: Saltwater fishing license required for age 17+ in saltwater
license_requirements.notes: Regulations valid September 1, 2025 through August 31, 2026. Possession limit equals double the bag limit unless otherwise noted. State waters extend 0-9 nautical miles in Gulf of Mexico.

species.bag_limit_notes: 5 fish combined of largemouth, smallmouth, Alabama, Guadalupe, and spotted bass
species.special_regulations: Some water bodies have different regulations (check Exceptions to Statewide Regulations)
species.geographic_restrictions: Statewide with exceptions on specific water bodies

species.bag_limit_notes: 5 fish combined of largemouth, smallmouth, Alabama, Guadalupe, and spotted bass
species.special_regulations: Combined bag limit with other black bass species
No size limit; combined with other black bass
No size limit; combined with other black bass
Lake Texoma has possession limit exception

species.bag_limit_notes: 25 combined with blue catfish; only 10 can be 20 inches or longer
species.special_regulations: Limit on number of large fish

species.bag_limit_notes: 25 combined with channel catfish; only 10 can be 20 inches or longer
species.special_regulations: Limit on number of large fish
Minimum on number under 16 inches protects smaller fish
Same as walleye
Mandatory harvest reporting required; release restrictions apply
species.geographic_restrictions: Limited to certain rivers and coastal waters

species.special_regulations: Protected species; no harvest

species.minimum_size_notes: 15 inches in state waters; 16 inches in federal waters when open
species.bag_limit_notes: 4 per person in state waters year-round; 2 per person in federal waters when open
species.season_open: Year-round in state waters; May 22 in federal waters
species.special_regulations: Circle hooks required. Federal season may close if quota reached.
species.geographic_restrictions: State waters (0-9 nautical miles) vs federal waters

species.bag_limit_notes: 3 per day within slot limit. One oversized fish (28+ inches) allowed with special tag per license year.
species.special_regulations: Slot limit: 15-20 inches. Oversized Spotted Seatrout Tag and Bonus Tag system for fish over 28 inches.

species.bag_limit_notes: 3 per person within slot. One over 28 inches allowed per license year with red drum tag or bonus tag
species.special_regulations: Slot limit: 20-28 inches. Tag system for oversized fish.
Slot limit

species.bag_limit_notes: 5 per day during open season; 0 during closure
species.special_regulations: Fall closure to protect spawning fish
Season set by NOAA/Gulf Council
Federally managed with limited seasons

species.bag_limit_notes: 1 per person; tag required for harvest
species.special_regulations: Special tarpon tag required for harvest. Most are catch and release
Slot limit; snook permit required
Some species protected; check regulations for prohibited species

data_sources_consulted: Arkansas Game and Fish Commission official website and 2026 regulations
Louisiana Department of Wildlife and Fisheries official regulations
Oklahoma Department of Wildlife Conservation official regulations
Texas Parks and Wildlife Department official regulations
NOAA Fisheries for federal waters species

coverage_summary.arkansas: 23 species covered including freshwater game fish, catfish, panfish, and trout with new 2026 regulations
coverage_summary.louisiana: 52 species covered including extensive freshwater and saltwater coverage for Gulf Coast fishing
coverage_summary.oklahoma: 18 species covered including freshwater game fish, catfish, and panfish
coverage_summary.texas: 45 species covered including freshwater and extensive saltwater Gulf Coast species

important_reminders: Always verify current regulations before fishing
Check for emergency orders and proclamations
Many water bodies have special regulations not captured in statewide rules
Federal waters (beyond state waters) may have different regulations
Harvest reporting required for some species (paddlefish, alligator gar)
Tag systems apply for oversized seatrout and red drum in Texas
Louisiana has complex water-body-specific regulations for bass and crappie
Arkansas implemented new restrictive trout regulations in 2026 due to hatchery crisis
measurement_notes: Total length: measured from tip of snout to tip of tail fin
Fork length: measured from tip of snout to fork of tail
Lower jaw fork length: for billfish, measured from lower jaw to fork of tail
Slot limits: fish must be between minimum and maximum sizes
Always clarify which measurement method applies to each species
